metadata.Title: CVE-2023-45866 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.Description:
[The HID Profile in multiple Bluetooth host stacks may acceptconnections with the HID control and HID interrupt channels ofthe HID Host role without MITM protection/mitigation and withoutuser confirmation on the Central role device. This can permit adevice like a keyboard (or emulating a keyboard) to successfullyconnect to a discoverable device without confirmation and permitkeystroke injection.]

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-45866` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

bluetooth - 5.66-0ubuntu1.1
bluez - 5.66-0ubuntu1.1
bluez-cups - 5.66-0ubuntu1.1
bluez-hcidump - 5.66-0ubuntu1.1
bluez-meshd - 5.66-0ubuntu1.1
bluez-obexd - 5.66-0ubuntu1.1
bluez-tests - 5.66-0ubuntu1.1
libbluetooth3 - 5.66-0ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: bluez package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.66-0ubuntu1.1').
